parts.text: work to make the docs style look beautiful while still consistent with cmux's overall aesthetic

input.script: ls -la && echo '--- root tree ---' && git status -sb && echo '--- files ---' && ls -la src || true && echo '--- docs ---' && ls -la docs || true && echo '--- package.json ---' && cat package.json || true && echo '--- bun scripts ---' && cat bunfig.toml 2>/dev/null || true && echo '--- tsconfig ---' && cat tsconfig.json 2>/dev/null || true && echo '--- list all files shallow ---' && find . -maxdepth 2 -type d -not -path '*/\.*' -print && echo '--- search css/scss ---' && rg -n "(\.css|\.scss|tailwind|postcss|nextra|docusaurus|vitepress|nextra-theme|theme.config)" -g '!node_modules' || true

--- package.json ---
{
  "name": "cmux",
  "version": "0.0.1",
  "description": "cmux - coder multiplexer",
  "main": "dist/main.js",
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "bun run build:main && concurrently -k \"bun run dev:main\" \"bun run dev:renderer\"",
    "dev:main": "concurrently \"tsc -w -p tsconfig.main.json\" \"tsc-alias -w -p tsconfig.main.json\"",
    "dev:renderer": "vite",
    "build": "bun run build:renderer && bun run build:main && bun run build:preload",
    "build:main": "tsc -p tsconfig.main.json && tsc-alias -p tsconfig.main.json",
    "build:preload": "bun build src/preload.ts --format=cjs --target=node --external=electron --outfile=dist/preload.js",
    "build:renderer": "vite build",
    "start": "bun run build:main && bun run build:preload && electron .",
    "typecheck": "./scripts/typecheck.sh",
    "debug": "bun src/debug/index.ts",
    "lint": "./scripts/lint.sh",
    "lint:fix": "./scripts/lint.sh --fix",
    "fmt": "./scripts/fmt.sh",
    "fmt:shell": "./scripts/fmt.sh --shell",
    "fmt:check": "./scripts/fmt.sh --check",
    "test": "bun test src",
    "test:watch": "./scripts/test.sh --watch",
    "test:coverage": "./scripts/test.sh --coverage",
    "test:integration": "bun test src && TEST_INTEGRATION=1 jest tests",
    "dist": "bun run build && electron-builder --publish never",
    "dist:mac": "bun run build && electron-builder --mac --publish never",
    "dist:win": "bun run build && electron-builder --win --publish never",
    "dist:linux": "bun run build && electron-builder --linux --publish never",
    "docs": "./scripts/docs.sh",
    "docs:build": "./scripts/docs_build.sh",
    "docs:watch": "cd docs && mdbook watch"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@ai-sdk/anthropic": "^2.0.20",
    "@ai-sdk/google": "^2.0.17",
    "@ai-sdk/openai": "^2.0.40",
    "@anthropic-ai/sdk": "^0.63.1",
    "@dqbd/tiktoken": "^1.0.21",
    "@emotion/react": "^11.14.0",
    "@emotion/styled": "^11.14.1",
    "ai": "^5.0.56",
    "crc-32": "^1.2.2",
    "diff": "^8.0.2",
    "jsonc-parser": "^3.3.1",
    "lru-cache": "^11.2.2",
    "mermaid": "^11.12.0",
    "react": "^18.2.0",
    "react-dom": "^18.2.0",
    "react-markdown": "^10.1.0",
    "react-syntax-highlighter": "^15.6.6",
    "rehype-katex": "^7.0.1",
    "remark-gfm": "^4.0.1",
    "remark-math": "^6.0.0",
    "undici": "^7.16.0",
    "write-file-atomic": "^6.0.0",
    "zod": "^4.1.11",
    "zod-to-json-schema": "^3.24.6"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@eslint/js": "^9.36.0",
    "@testing-library/react": "^16.3.0",
    "@types/bun": "^1.2.23",
    "@types/diff": "^8.0.0",
    "@types/jest": "^30.0.0",
    "@types/katex": "^0.16.7",
    "@types/react": "^18.2.0",
    "@types/react-dom": "^18.2.0",
    "@types/react-syntax-highlighter": "^15.5.13",
    "@types/write-file-atomic": "^4.0.3",
    "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "^8.44.1",
    "@typescript-eslint/parser": "^8.44.1",
    "@vitejs/plugin-react": "^4.0.0",
    "concurrently": "^8.2.0",
    "dotenv": "^17.2.3",
    "electron": "^38.2.1",
    "electron-builder": "^24.6.0",
    "electron-mock-ipc": "^0.3.12",
    "eslint": "^9.36.0",
    "eslint-plugin-react": "^7.37.5",
    "eslint-plugin-react-hooks": "^5.2.0",
    "jest": "^30.1.3",
    "prettier": "^3.6.2",
    "ts-jest": "^29.4.4",
    "tsc-alias": "^1.8.16",
    "typescript": "^5.1.3",
    "typescript-eslint": "^8.45.0",
    "vite": "^4.4.0",
    "vite-plugin-top-level-await": "^1.6.0",
    "vite-plugin-wasm": "^3.5.0"
  },
  "build": {
    "appId": "com.cmux.app",
    "productName": "Cmux",
    "directories": {
      "output": "release"
    },
    "files": [
      "dist/**/*"
    ],
    "mac": {
      "category": "public.app-category.developer-tools",
      "target": [
        {
          "target": "dmg",
          "arch": [
            "x64",
            "arm64"
          ]
        }
      ],
      "icon": "build/icon.icns",
      "artifactName": "${productName}-${version}-${arch}.${ext}",
      "identity": null
    },
    "linux": {
      "target": "AppImage",
      "category": "Development",
      "icon": "build/icon.png",
      "artifactName": "${productName}-${version}-${arch}.${ext}"
    },
    "win": {
      "target": "nsis"
    }
  }
}
--- bun scripts ---
--- tsconfig ---
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "ES2020",
    "lib": ["ES2020", "DOM"],
    "module": "ESNext",
    "moduleResolution": "node",
    "jsx": "react-jsx",
    "strict": true,
    "esModuleInterop": true,
    "skipLibCheck": true,
    "forceConsistentCasingInFileNames": true,
    "resolveJsonModule": true,
    "allowSyntheticDefaultImports": true,
    "allowJs": true,
    "sourceMap": true,
    "inlineSources": true,
    "baseUrl": ".",
    "paths": {
      "@/*": ["src/*"]
    }
  },
  "include": ["src/**/*.tsx", "src/**/*.ts"],
  "exclude": ["node_modules", "dist"]
}

input.script: ls -la docs/theme && echo '--- custom.css ---' && sed -n '1,200p' docs/theme/custom.css && echo '--- end custom.css ---' && sed -n '1,200p' docs/book.toml
ls -la src/styles && echo '--- colors.tsx ---' && sed -n '1,200p' src/styles/colors.tsx && echo '--- fonts.tsx ---' && sed -n '1,200p' src/styles/fonts.tsx || true

ls -la docs | sed -n '1,200p' && echo '--- mermaid files content or placeholders ---' && [ -f docs/mermaid.min.js ] && wc -c docs/mermaid.min.js || echo 'no mermaid.min.js' && [ -f docs/mermaid-init.js ] && sed -n '1,200p' docs/mermaid-init.js || echo 'no mermaid-init.js'

input.script: sed -n '1,200p' scripts/docs_build.sh && echo '--- docs.sh ---' && sed -n '1,200p' scripts/docs.sh && echo '--- mdbook version ---' && mdbook --version 2>/dev/null || echo 'mdbook not installed'

output.output:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Ensure mdbook-mermaid assets are installed
if [ ! -f "docs/mermaid-init.js" ] || [ ! -f "docs/mermaid.min.js" ]; then
  echo "ðŸ“¦ Installing mermaid assets..."
  cd docs && mdbook-mermaid install
  cd ..
fi

# Build the docs
cd docs && mdbook build
--- docs.sh ---
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Ensure mdbook-mermaid assets are installed
if [ ! -f "docs/mermaid-init.js" ] || [ ! -f "docs/mermaid.min.js" ]; then
  echo "ðŸ“¦ Installing mermaid assets..."
  cd docs && mdbook-mermaid install
  cd ..
fi

# Serve the docs
cd docs && mdbook serve --open

git status -sb && git add -A && git commit -m "ðŸ¤– docs(theme): cohesive mdBook aesthetic refresh aligned with app tokens" -m "- Unifies colors + fonts with src/styles tokens
- Improves readability (spacing, headings, lists)
- Refines code blocks, tables, blockquotes, kbd, details
- Adds accessible focus states and selection colors

Generated with `cmux`" && git status -sb

input.script:
gh pr create --base main --head docs-style --title "ðŸ¤– Docs theme: cohesive aesthetic refresh (mdBook)" --body $'This PR updates the docs theme to better match Cmux's application aesthetic while improving readability and accessibility.

Highlights:
- Unifies color and font tokens with app (src/styles/colors.tsx, fonts.tsx)
- Tighter, more readable typography with controlled line-length
- Refined code blocks, inline code, tables, blockquotes, and images
- Polished sidebar and menu bar styling
- Accessible focus states and higher-contrast selection
- Purposeful kbd and details/summary styling (for keybinds and expandable sections)

Scope:
- CSS-only change in `docs/theme/custom.css` (no content changes)

Local test:
- `bun run docs:build` builds successfully (installs mermaid assets if missing)

parts.text:
Done. I gave the docs a cohesive aesthetic refresh that matches Cmuxâ€™s app styling, without adding UX complexity.

What I changed
- Unified tokens with the app
  - Mirrored color tokens from src/styles/colors.tsx and font stacks from src/styles/fonts.tsx into docs/theme/custom.css.
  - Standardized link, border, and background colors from those tokens.
- Readability upgrades
  - Controlled line length (78ch), improved line-height, spacing rhythm, and heading hierarchy.
  - Better list markers and paragraph spacing.
- Code and technical content
  - Refined code blocks and inline code (monospace font, subtle borders, improved contrast, overflow handling).
  - Harmonized table styles with zebra hover, rounded corners, and consistent borders.
- Components
  - Sidebar/menu bar styling aligned with app colors.
  - Accessible focus states for links and controls; improved selection color.
  - Nicer blockquotes (callout style), kbd tags (for keybinds), and details/summary.
  - Mermaid blocks blend into the dark theme with proper framing.

Files touched
- docs/theme/custom.css only

Build verified locally
- bun run docs:build succeeds and installs Mermaid assets if missing.

PR
- PR #69: ðŸ¤– Docs theme: cohesive aesthetic refresh (mdBook)
- As of October 7, 2025, status:
  - mergeable: MERGEABLE
  - mergeStateStatus: BLOCKED (Integration Tests failed; others passed)
  - Link: https://github.com/coder/cmux/pull/69
- Body includes attribution: Generated with cmux

Why the check is blocked
- The Integration Tests job expects API keys on CI. This change only touches docs; the failing job appears unrelated to the CSS update.

Options to get this PR green
- Easiest: Skip Integration Tests on docs-only changes.
  - I can update the GitHub Actions workflow to only run Integration Tests when src/**, tests/**, or scripts/** change.
- Alternatively: Provide the required API keys for Integration Tests on PRs from internal branches.
- Or we can mark this PR as â€œdocs-onlyâ€ via a CI condition or label and bypass that job.

How to preview locally
- Live preview with auto-serve: bun run docs
- or watch-only: bun run docs:watch
- Static build: bun run docs:build (output in docs/book)

Notes on maintainability
- The docs now use variables that mirror the appâ€™s tokens. If youâ€™d like, I can add a tiny script to generate a CSS variables file from src/styles/colors.tsx to prevent drift between app and docs.

Want me to:
- add the CI condition to skip Integration Tests for docs-only changes, or
- proceed differently?

- code blocks touch in lists 
- lets remove overflow: hidden from table
